channel.title: Setting a Timer on a command
channel.description:
Is there a certain way to set a time on a command? for example -- ::vote
Could i set a timer on it? so you cant use it again for another 24 hours? if so, how?

item.title: Setting a Timer on a command
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:4, topic:462685”]Make a timer, make it a long. Set it at how ever many mS are in 24 hrs. Everytime that timer goes to 0, make a boolean in the player’s account that is true if it is 0, and the mS/24 hrs if it’s false.

The timer is also in the player’s stuff.

When they type in the command, it equals mS/24 hrs[/quote]

Ahh i see now. thank you.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting a Timer on a command

item.title: Setting a Timer on a command
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Make a timer, make it a long. Set it at how ever many mS are in 24 hrs. Everytime that timer goes to 0, make a boolean in the player’s account that is true if it is 0, and the mS/24 hrs if it’s false.

The timer is also in the player’s stuff.

When they type in the command, it equals mS/24 hrs
